item.title: NIS status related requests
item.description: NIS status related requests There are two requests by which you can get information about the status of NIS. The /heartbeat request gives you information if the node is up and responsive. The /status request gives more detailed information about the state of NIS. Both requests return a NemRequestResult object. See Appendix A: [NemRequestResult]() for more details on the interpretation of a NemRequestResult.

item.title: 2.1 Heart beat request
item.description: Heart Beat Request curl "http://127.0.0.1:7890/heartbeat" Example of returned JSON object: { "code": 1, "type": 2, "message": "ok" } API path: Request type: /heartbeat GET Description: Determines if NIS is up and responsive. No Parameter. Possible Errors: If there is no response to this request, NIS is either not running or is in a state where it can’t serve requests.

item.title: 2.2. Status Request
item.description: Status Request curl "http://127.0.0.1:7890/status" Example of returned JSON object: { "code": 6, "type": 4, "message": "status" } API path: Request type: /status GET Description: Determines the status of NIS. No Parameter The code can be interpreted as follows: 0: Unknown status. 1: NIS is stopped. 2: NIS is starting. 3: NIS is running. 4: NIS is booting the local node (implies NIS is running).
